body_html:
@drpngx : We want to understand the impact of this behavior of min/max function in the tensorflow (usage of Relu/Max operator).
As per IEEE754 standard, max(x, Nan) = max(Nan, x) = x. So, it seems Power's behavior is as per IEEE rule.
body_text:
@drpngx : We want to understand the impact of this behavior of min/max function in the tensorflow (usage of Relu/Max operator).
As per IEEE754  standard, max(x, Nan) = max(Nan, x) = x. So, it seems Power's behavior is as per IEEE rule.
body:
@drpngx : We want to understand the impact of this behavior of min/max function in the tensorflow (usage of Relu/Max operator). 
As per [IEEE754 ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/jj218760(v=vs.85).aspx#alpha_754_Deviations) standard, max(x, Nan) = max(Nan, x) = x. So, it seems Power's behavior is as per IEEE rule.
